member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.DirectManipulation.Adapter.Interaction.HandleGraphicsExtensions.GetRotationHandleGraphics(Tekla.BIM.DirectManipulation.Services.Interaction.IHandleGraphic,Tekla.Common.Geometry.Arc3)
member.summary: Draws the given visualization data as a rotation handle.
member.remarks: When the handle is selected, the arrow on the start point of arc indicating positive rotation direction and the one fourth of the circle with solid lines are drawn. Then for the remaining circle, every second of the segment is drawn, therefore we only need to draw 1/4 + 1/8 + 1/8 + 1/8 = 5/8 of the full circle. Therefor we need 1 / (5/8) = 1.6 * of segments.
member.param: The instance to draw as a rotation handle.
member.returns: The drawn for the given data.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.DirectManipulation.Adapter.DebugToolInvoker.GetInvocationMethod
member.summary: Gets a delegate to the method which can invoke the debug tool.
member.remarks: The invocation method is retrieved via reflection, otherwise the assemblies would have a circular dependency. In theory the debug tool should be part of the Tekla.Structures.DirectManipulation project, but that would introduce the requirement for the platform to allow the adapter to look at the internal functionality. Such accessibility might make development in the adapter confusing.
member.returns: A delegate to the method which can invoke the debug tool; or null, in case of failure.

member.summary: Invokes the debug tool by calling the value of .

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.DirectManipulation.Adapter.State.CommandEventBroker
member.summary: The class handles callbacks from TS core through . This class provides a work around for the multiple different events coming from TS core, which is especially required for the case of RebarShapeCatalog.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.DirectManipulation.Adapter.State.CommandEventBroker.ComponentsHandledOnPluginStart
member.summary: The collection of components that for which handling must be delayed by to .

remarks.para: The delay allows TS to set additional data.

For example with RebarShapeCatalog: - The command starts the dialog, we can not start the feature yet - When the user presses OK in that dialog - Current values are set and made accessible for the DialogData.GetCurrentValuesFromTs method - The feature can be started
Do NOT add other components to this hack!! In stead, review the architecture!!
